description.p: Through many years of intense research, the greatest and most unethical arcane scholars managed to tap into a previously unkown source of magical power called Soul Power. Since then, they have founded a secret school to research the side effects of using soul power, but also to slowly build an army of Soul Gatherers.

A soul gatherer can be quickly identified by their soul beacon. Every beacon is different, but they all share a glow coming from within it. They are the source of a gatherer’s power and with it a gatherer may collect soul power, cast spells and empower themselves or any allies that they manage to acquire.

Many soul gatherers are loyal to the institution that trained them and are later sent on missions all around Faleria, while others defect and hide from their former teachers. What they do have in common is their secretive nature about their time spent in training.

Soul gatherers are usually driven by either their desire to serve their superiors or the urge for personal growth, both compelling them to travel the world and empower themselves through souls. This desire to serve may blind these warriors to the true motivations of their teachers.

Due to their recency, some gatherers are smistaken for simple warlocks, others have become the centre of scary stories to tell children and some others are subjugated to the role of mythical heroes. In general, they are feared but not hunted nor imprisioned on sight.
Every creature’s soul has power inside of it. Some souls are more powerful than others though, and these are gold mines for gatherers.
A creature only has usable soul power when it has 5 or more maximum hit points. Creatures, other than constructs and undead, have 1 soul power per 5 maximum hit points.

As you make your soul gatherer spend some time thinking about why they gather and spend soul power. Do they empower themselves to make mighty slashes with their longsword or do they hord it to be able to increase their own life? Think about the reason they joined the school as well as it is the whole reason they have their abilities.

Some relevant questions to awnser about your character might be: Why did you join the school? What’s your beacon? Does your beacon have any connection to your past? Do you enjoy seeing the soul leave the body?

You can quickly create a soul gatherer by following these suggestions. Firstly, choose Wisdom to be your highest ability score, followed by Strength. Secondly, choose the soldier background and grab a one-handed weapon, choose a beacon and some medium armor and you should be ready to go.
As a Soul Gatherer, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Dice: 1d8 per Soul Ghaterer level
Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per Soul Ghaterer level after 1st
Skills: Choose two from Arcana, Athletics, History, Insight, Perception, Stealth or Survival

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) any simple weapon or (b) any martial weapon
(a) any simple weapon or (b) five javelins
An explorer’s pack, caligrapher’s supplies and a soul beacon

description.p: At level 1 you gain your first soul bond. A soul bond is a connection created by a soul gatherer and the world around them. As an action, the gatherer may bind themself to an ally, an enemy or to their beacon. To bind yourself to a creature with gatherable soul power you must use their cr or levels worth of soul power. There is no cost to bind yourself to an object, such as a beacon, nor to a creature with no harvestable soul power. Creating a soul bond with a creature reveals how much soul power they possess, but only lasts 1 minute.

Bonds to creatures or objects can only be broken by the dispel magic or similar spells, by the death of the soul gatherer, by the death of the creature the bond is made with, via the destruction of the the bond was made with.
You gain additional bonds at levels 3, 7, 10 and 15.

tr.td: Soul Bond, Soul Beacon, Soul Catcher
Soul Magic, Soul Sense, Fighting Style
Soul Bond (2), Path of the Soul
Soul Bond (3), Path of the Soul feature
Soul Bond (4), Path of the Soul feature
Soul Bond (5), Path of the Soul feature

sheet.description: A master of martial combat, skilled with a variety of weapons and armor.

setters.set: A master of martial combat, skilled with a variety of weapons and armor.
Light armor, medium armor, shields, simple weapons, martial weapons

description.p: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can’t take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.
While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.
When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.
When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. You must be wielding a shield.
When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.
You have a limited well of stamina that you can draw on to protect yourself from harm. On your turn, you can use a bonus action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your fighter level.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.
Starting at 2nd level, you can push yourself beyond your normal limits for a moment. On your turn, you can take one additional action on top of your regular action and a possible bonus action.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again. Starting at 17th level, you can use it twice before a rest, but only once on the same turn.

sheet.description: On your turn, you can take one additional action on top of your regular action.
On your turn, you can take one additional action on top of your regular action.

description.p: At 3rd level, you choose an archetype that you strive to emulate in your combat styles and techniques. The Champion archetype is detailed at the end of the class description; see the Player’s Handbook for information on other martial archetypes. Your archetype grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 10th, 15th, and 18th level.

When you reach 4th level, and again at 6th, 8th, 12th, 14th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.
The number of attacks increases to three when you reach 11th level in this class and to four when you reach 20th level in this class.

sheet.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn
You can attack three times, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn
You can attack four times, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn

description.p: Beginning at 9th level, you can reroll a saving throw that you fail. If you do so, you must use the new roll, and you can’t use this feature again until you finish a long rest.
You can use this feature twice between long rests starting at 13th level and three times between long rests starting at 17th level.

sheet.description: You can reroll a saving throw that you fail. If you do so, you must use the new roll.

description.p: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

sheet.description: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

sheet.description: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.
